intro: Oiospermum molle, commonly known as the silky oiosperm, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, fluffy seeds that are easily dispersed by the wind, aiding in its propagation. Its leaves are typically silvery-gray, covered in fine, soft hairs that help reduce water loss. Oiospermum molle thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
